page.title: 11Interview _Local Doctor
page.content: {Q. What do you think are the main {differences between the modern role of {a doctor in The N.H.S. and that of the {old family practitioner?} A. The biggest difference is we are now one of a team, whereas there used to be one doctor on his own. Now we work together with nurses, midwives, health visitors and social services, all organized from the same building, the Health Centre. {Q. Is a doctors job harder due to the {fact that he does'nt know individual {patients personally.} A. It would be if that were true, but I would dispute it. There are five doctors working together at this health centre and we have about 11,000 patients. Obviously we can't get to know every single one of them, but most of these are healthy and we only see about 5% to 10% of that number.
